intro: Styloncerus plumiger, commonly known as the plum-winged styloncerus, is a species of beetle belonging to the family Cerambycidae. It is characterized by its distinctive, ornate wing covers that are often adorned with intricate patterns and colors. The larvae of this species typically feed on dead or decaying wood, playing a role in the decomposition process within forest ecosystems. Adults are often found in moist, wooded areas where they contribute to pollination and nutrient cycling. Its unique morphology and ecological niche make it an important subject of study in entomology and biodiversity research.
